Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible source provided to verify the statement made by the Sri Lankan Opposition Leader.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the local Covid-19 cure mentioned in the alleged newspaper article is not effective without providing any evidence or scientific basis for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no recognized cure for Covid-19 as of December 3, 2020, according to international health bodies.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the opposition leader's statement by presenting it as a complete lack of faith in the local Covid-19 cure, without providing the full context or any supporting statements from the leader.
Understate: There is no indication of any understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times by presenting a misleading newspaper article that has been doctored, thus undermining its credibility.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias evident in the claim.
